item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, April 30, 2025 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Sycophancy in GPT-4o (64 points | 31 comments)
2. Jepsen: Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL 17.4 (316 points | 85 comments)
3. Chain of Recursive Thoughts: Make AI think harder by making it argue with itself (395 points | 188 comments)
4. An illustrated guide to automatic sparse differentiation (45 points | 2 comments)
5. I use zip bombs to protect my server (434 points | 219 comments)
6. Bamba: An open-source LLM that crosses a transformer with an SSM (145 points | 46 comments)
7. Everything we announced at our first LlamaCon (155 points | 75 comments)
8. Only Teslas exempt from new auto tariffs thanks to 85% domestic content rule (365 points | 328 comments)
9. My sourdough starter has twins (25 points | 1 comment)
10. WorldGen: Open-source 3D scene generator for Game/VR/XR (31 points | 4 comments)
11. Performance optimization is hard because it's fundamentally a brute-force task (236 points | 99 comments)
12. It's School time: Adventures in hacking an old Kindle (93 points | 18 comments)

14. Show HN: An MCP server for understanding AWS costs (49 points | 5 comments)
15. Programming languages should have a tree traversal primitive (202 points | 144 comments)

20. Modern Realty (YC S24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
21. China's Clinical Trial Boom (133 points | 67 comments)
22. Finding paths of least action with gradient descent (2023) (39 points | 5 comments)
23. Show HN: AgenticSeek – Self-hosted alternative to cloud-based AI tools (77 points | 12 comments)
24. O3 beats a master-level GeoGuessr player, even with fake EXIF data (389 points | 273 comments)
25. Show HN: An interactive demo of QR codes' error correction (70 points | 8 comments)
26. Path Isn't Real on Linux (78 points | 69 comments)
27. Indian court orders blocking of Proton Mail (324 points | 147 comments)
28. Waymo and Toyota outline partnership to advance autonomous driving deployment (355 points | 293 comments)
29. Princeton Engineering Anomalies Research (2010) (21 points | 1 comment)
30. LibreLingo – FOSS Alternative to Duolingo (705 points | 314 comments)
